title: Fans paid $90 to see Kylie Jenner ex-boyfriend Tyga perform Australia but only played for 15 minutes
text:
Hundreds of fans were left outraged after paying up to $90 to see Kylie Jenner's ex-boyfriend Tyga perform live, only for him to play for 15 minutes.

The rapper is currently touring Australia and New Zealand, and stopped off in Wollongong, south of Sydney, for a sold out show on Sunday.

The highly-anticipated event at Towradgi Beach Hotel and Waves sold out weeks in advance.

Hundreds of people are furious after paying up to $90 to see Kylie Jenner's ex-boyfriend and rapper Tyga perform live, only for him to play for 15 minutes

The event kicked off at 6pm while the rapper was expected to go onstage at 11.15pm.

Fans paid up to $90 each for the event but were forced to listen to other DJs for four hours before before Tyga eventually started performing at 11.45pm.

Fans were left outraged and many people felt ripped off.

Emily-Jayne Jackson was furious after the lights turned on and the rapper began to say goodbye to people.

'He started to high-five people before walking off the stage,' the 20-year-old told Daily Mail Australia.

'The lights turned on when he was still performing and I was like what's going on?'

Ms Jackson said as soon as the clock hit midnight police officers walked in as the crowd chanted for him to perform another song.

'Police walked in and then Tyga was high-fiving people and the lights turned on and everyone was ushered out,' Ms Jackson said.

Fans waited up to five hours to see Tyga in Wollongong, who performed for just 15 minutes

Fans paid up to $90 each for the event but were forced to listen to other DJs for four hours before before Tyga eventually started performing at 11.45pm

Some attendees have demanded refunds, claiming they did not get their money's worth.

'$80 to listen to DJs play the same damn songs for more than four hours and have him only play for like 15 minutes? I want a damn refund,' one woman said.

'The poster only said Tyga, it didn't mention a DJ playing for five hours before hand, otherwise no one would have showed up until 10pm,' another said.

'They made out like it was all going to be Tyga and to only get 15 mins of him, for that price, is f***ed.'

The sub-promoter for the event told Daily Mail Australia that they purchased the show through entertainment agency Lucky Urbn, who had the responsibility of handling the logistics of the show and getting Tyga to the venue.

'I’d like to apologise to everyone who came to the show and say that it’s out of our control,' he said.

'I understand people may have felt unhappy or underwhelmed, we did everything to provide a memorable experience and his team let everyone down.'

'Last night’s show is not a representation of how I run by business, and I am appalled this has happened to his hardworking fans.'

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Tyga's representatives for comment.
description: The rapper is currently touring Australia and New Zealand, and stopped off in Wollongong, south of Sydney, for a sold out show on Sunday.
authors: Lauren Ferri For Daily Mail Australia
